poem:
### In Memory of Sue Barker

At dawn, the village awoke to her soft resolve,  
A guardian's shadow lengthening over fields,  
Her hands mending broken wings,  
Words a balm for each injured heart.  
Years of fierce tenderness carried to the end,  
Yet the echo of her devotion  
Lays gently over Royston, still  
Cradling the children she loved.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Over more than five decades in social work she brought her fierce integrity to some of the toughest cases in England and Wales.
